      • getOpenWindows

        java.util.List<Window> getOpenWindows()
        Returns all open windows of a player. If the player has not any open windows this method will return an empty List.
        Returns:
        all open windows of a player
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player is null

      • getMaximizedWindow

        Window getMaximizedWindow()
        Returns the maximized window of a player. If the player does not have a maximized window this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the maximized window
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player is null

      • getWindow

        Window getWindow(int index)
        Returns the window-instance stored with the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - to get the window
        Returns:
        the window-instance stored with the specified index
        Throws:
        APIException - if the index is smaller than 0 or greater than the count of the opened windows
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player is null

      • hasMaximizedWindow

        boolean hasMaximizedWindow()
        Returns true if the player has a maximized window and false if not.
        Returns:
        true if the player has a maximized window and false is not
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player is null

      • hasOpenWindow

        boolean hasOpenWindow(Window window)
        Returns true if the player has a opened a specified window- instance and false if not.
        Parameters:
        window - The window instance to check
        Returns:
        true if the player has a maximized window and false is not
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player or the window is null

      • open

        void open(Window window)
        Opens a window to a player. This window will be automatically maximized and if the player already has a maximized window, the current window will be minimized. The current window will be maximized, if the player closes the new window. The window, witch will be minimized, will get the Status.BACKGROUND. If you do not want, that the current window will be maximized on closing the new window, invoke minimize() before opening the new window. The WindowOpenEvent will be called in the EventManager. To maximize the new window, the method maximize(Window) will be called.
        Parameters:
        window - to open
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player or the window is null.
        APIException - if the window is already opened by a player.

      • close

        void close(Window window)
        Closes an open window to a player. The window to close does not has to be in the state Status.MAXIMIZED. All other states are possible too and the window will be closed. If the closing window is the maximized window of the given player the method minimize() will be called. The WindowCloseEvent will be called in the EventManager.
        Parameters:
        window - to close
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player or the window is null
        APIException - if the given player does not own the given window

      • close

        void close(int index)
        Closes the window stored with the given index, calling close(Window). To get the window to close the method getWindow(int) will be used.
        Parameters:
        index - to get the window to close.
        See Also:
        getWindow(int), close(Window)

      • closeAll

        void closeAll()
        Closes all open windows from a specified player, calling close(Window)
        See Also:
        close(Window)

      • maximize

        void maximize(Window window)
        Maximizes a window to a player. If a window is currently maximized the current window will get the state Status.BACKGROUND. If the new maximized window gets minimized the first window with the state Status.BACKGROUND will be automatically maximized. The WindowMaximizeEvent will be called in the EventManager.
        Parameters:
        window - to maximize
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player or the window is null
        APIException - if the player does not own the window to maximize or the window is already maximized to the given player

      • maximize

        void maximize(int index)
        Maximizes the window saved with a given index, calling maximize(Window). To get the window to maximize the method getWindow(int) will be used.
        Parameters:
        index - to get the window to maximize
        See Also:
        getWindow(int), maximize(Window)

      • minimize

        void minimize()
        Minimizes the currently maximized window. If the player does not have a maximized window this method will do nothing. If the player has any other opened windows with the state Status.BACKGROUND the first window with this state will be maximized with a little delay of one tick. The WindowMinimizeEvent will be called in the EventManager.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the player is null
